channel.title: Krishna Mohan A M | RSS Feed
channel.description: Personal site of Krishna Mohan, who blogs about tech, football and trivia.

image.title: Krishna Mohan A M | RSS Feed

item.title: Thoughts on -10x Engineer
item.description: My thoughts on the blog post 'How to be a -10x engineer', which was quite popular in Hacker News.

item.title: Deploying a nodejs app in fly.io and some struggles
item.description: This is a brief writeup about deploying a simple nodejs application in fly.io. While doing it I had to overcome few technical difficulties and if you can avoid it, it may help you to save some time.

item.title: A failed app idea and some new learnings
item.description: If we could generate transcript files offline, how can we integrate it with audio files. I was thinking about something similar to external subtitle files used in video players. Came to know that it is possible with the help of TextTracks and WebVTT format. I did a small POC and it went well.

item.title: Run Stable Diffusion in Azure
item.description: Hardware requirement are pretty challenging for most of the machine learning needs, stable diffusion is no different. I've an Azure subscription can I make use of that?

item.title: പ്രഭാത നടത്തം
item.description: A short story

item.title: What's new in Angular? - Standalone components
item.description: Last week Angular team released v15 of the framework which is a major release with a lot of new features. Among that, standalone components are out of developer preview and is stable now. It is also accompanied by a set of new standalone APIs to enhance the development.

item.title: Messaging between Service Worker and Angular component
item.description: Most of the time service worker logic and application logic work in isolation, but there will be cases where we need to do pass messages between them. In this post we’ll see how we can do this in an angular application.

item.title: How to implement CQRS with MediatR - Part 2
item.description: This post is about implementing mediator pattern in a dotnet WebAPI using MediatR library.

item.title: How to implement CQRS with MediatR - Part 1
item.description: This post is about implementing mediator pattern in a dotnet console application using MediatR library.

item.description: Weekly summarization and review of things I've learned in the third week of February 2021

item.title: Using Casbin for authorization in dotnet
item.description: Casbin is a powerful and efficient open-source access control library. It provides support for enforcing authorization based on various access control models. Here I'll be sharing my thoughts on Casbin.NET, an authorization library for dotnet.

item.title: Understanding Google Outages on December 14, 2020
item.description: An overview of two major outages happened on 14th December, 2020. This is not an authoritative analysis but can be considered as notes regarding the aforesaid incidents.

item.description: Weekly summarization and review of things I've learned in the first week of January 2021

item.title: File Upload - With Angular and Dotnet Core Web API
item.description: Minimal implementation of file upload using Angular and dotnet core web API.

item.title: Understanding Git - Merge, Rebase & Bisect
item.description: In any git workflow, branching and merging code is unavoidable. In this post we are having a not-so deeper look at the three important git commands viz. git-merge, git-rebase and git-bisect.

item.title: Generating Code Coverage Reports in Dotnet Core
item.description: Unlike other application frameworks .NET Core do not provide code coverage reports out of the box. Here I’ll be using a different approach which actually suited my web application. Without further ado, let’s get started.

item.title: Embedding Power BI in Angular — Part 2
item.description: Power BI can be embedded for the users of your organization who have access to it. This requires the users to sign-in to their Power BI account to view their content, which are the reports they own or the ones that have been shared with them. This is the second part of the two-part article series.

item.title: Embedding Power BI in Angular — Part 1
item.description: Power BI is a powerful tool which helps us to create quick and interactive insights from wide range of data sources. Here we’ll be discussing about Power BI service which is a SaaS, and how to embed Power BI Dashboards, Reports and Tiles in web applications.
